Bayesian HPD Regions

Source: R/AllGenerics.R, R/interval.R
hpdi.Rd

Bayesian HPD Regions

interval_hpd(object, ...)

# S4 method for MCMC
interval_hpd(object, level = 0.95, ...)

Arguments

object

A numeric vector or an MCMC object containing the output of the MCMC algorithm for the parameter.
...

Extra arguments to be passed to hdrcde::hdr().
level

A length-one numeric vector giving the confidence level.

Value

A list of two columns numeric matrix giving the lower and upper boundaries of the HPD interval.

References

Hyndman, R. J. (1996). Computing and graphing highest density regions. American Statistician, 50: 120-126. doi: 10.2307/2684423 .

See also

hdrcde::hdr()

Other statistics: ci, summary()

Author

A. Philippe, M.-A. Vibet, T. S. Dye, N. Frerebeau

Examples

## Coerce to MCMC
events <- as_mcmc(Events, iteration = 1)
events <- events[1:10000, ]

## Credible interval
interval_credible(events, level = 0.95)

#>              lower     upper
#> Event.2  -1045.210  -202.337
#> Event.1  -1979.810 -1613.590
#> Event.22  -809.057  -459.090
#> Event.12 -1400.040 -1064.290
#> attr(,"level")
#> [1] 0.95
#> attr(,"calendar")
#> [1] "BCAD"

## HPD regions
interval_hpd(events, level = 0.95)

#> $Event.2
#>          lower     upper
#> [1,] -1057.075 -211.8043
#> 
#> $Event.1
#>          lower     upper
#> [1,] -1973.903 -1605.115
#> 
#> $Event.22
#>          lower     upper
#> [1,] -822.9642 -466.8201
#> 
#> $Event.12
#>         lower     upper
#> [1,] -1402.57 -1066.077
#> 
#> attr(,"level")
#> [1] 0.95
#> attr(,"calendar")
#> [1] "BCAD"
